intro: Silene oliganthella, commonly known as the narrowleaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine or arid regions. Silene oliganthella has small, narrow leaves and produces seeds in capsules that are dispersed by wind. It is a short-lived perennial that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native environment.
